structure.unit: LICENSING OF MOTOR VEHICLES, OPERATORS, AND TRAILERS

law.catch_line: Exemption of operators of road or farm machinery and persons in Armed Forces.

text.section: No person need obtain an operator's license to operate a road roller, road machinery or any tractor or implement of husbandry temporarily drawn or propelled on the highways.

Every person in the service of the Army, Navy or Marine Corps of the United States, when furnished with an operator's permit from the United States, shall be exempt from an operator's license when operating an official vehicle in the course of his service.

law.history: Amended 1950 Ky. Acts ch. 176, sec. 2, effective July 1, 1950. -- Amended 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 4. -- Amended 1944 Ky. Acts ch. 74, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2739m-35.
